remarks: Lemma for ~ kur14 .  If ` k ` is the complementation operator and ` k ` is the closure operator, this expresses the identity ` k c k A = k c k c k c k A ` for any subset ` A ` of the topological space.  This is the key result that lets us cut down long enough sequences of ` c k c k ... ` that arise when applying closure and complement repeatedly to ` A ` , and explains why we end up with a number as large as ` 1 4 ` , yet no larger.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 11-Feb-2015.)
